content.description:
This is an overhanging, flaring OW.

It is an open project, and the rating is only a wild guess.

Please clean up any bodily fluids on the rock before leaving.
content.protection: Lead or TR it. For a TR, you can place #0.5 to #2 Camalots in a downward-facing flake up high on the right, or use very long slings around blocks down low. You'll also want a wadded-up shirt or whatever to keep the rope out of the crack-notch at the lip.
content.location: This is around on the back (S) side of Area A. Approach via the east.

content.description: Walk up the ramp, and chimney/stem up the pillar, being careful of the kitty litter raining down. The crack on the left is pretty solid but flares out pretty quickly.
content.protection: You can set a TR in the horizontal at the top (size #2-4), otherwise your climbing ability is your pro.
content.location:
It is 15 feet left of

Easy, Left Angler

.

content.description:
Find the right spot and do it. Note: the problem does not go up the inside corner to the left.

Ground rules: start by hanging on the edge/lip.
content.protection: A crash pad is optional.
content.location: See the overview map and Area E map. It is tucked away on SE side of a small/medium boulder.

content.description:
Start deep (slightly contrived), and follow the left-leaning crack to the top. It is mostly hands.

Ground rules: start in a sit/hang as far in as you can get with your feet high.
content.protection: Boulder it, spotter, and/or crash pad.
content.location: See the overview map and Area e (Slash Boulders) map. It is on southwest side of the medium-sized boulder.

content.description: This is moderately long with a lean to the left, and it is mostly fists.
content.protection: Boulder/solo or TR if desired.
content.location: See the Area D map. It is around the back on the west side.

content.description:
Climb a tight hands splitter going to fingers. Scramble down grunge on the back side.

Ground rules for 10b: sit start.

Ground rules for 5.9: standing start.
content.protection: A crash pad or a spotter.
content.location: See the Area D map. It is right of the corridor.

content.description:
Climb a right-angling, grungy, crumbling flake on the outside corner of the block.

Ground rules: start with at least one foot on the ground.
content.protection: You can set up a TR with #1 to #3 Camalots in a horizontal at the top. It is really short for a TR, but the landing area is bad due to a small boulder.
content.location: See the Area D map. It is on the right side at the entrance of the corridor.

content.description:
This is contrived but fun. Climb really short hands and fists through a bulge.

Ground rules: sit/laydown start. Keep both hands and both feet in the crack - Don't use any face holds.
content.protection: None - it's an ass scraper.
content.location: See the area map. It is on the left side of the corridor down low.

content.description:
This is the gem of the area. It is an overhanging mostly hands crack that is almost hard to fall out of. You can step back onto the block at the top to get off.

Ground rules: sit start.
content.protection: None or use a spotter.
content.location: It is on  the north (right) side of the corridor.

content.description: Squirm up the down-flaring slot. Rap from a single bolt on top.
content.protection: One #3 (or #4?) and one #6 Camalot or equivalent.
content.location: See the “Area D overview” drawing in the photos. It climbs the south side of the pinch point up high above the chimney.

content.description: Squirm up the down-flaring slot. Rap from a single bolt on top.
content.protection: One each #2, #5, & #6 Camalots or equivalent.
content.location: See the “Area D overview” drawing in the photos. This climbs the north side of the pinch point up high above the chimney.

content.description:
Traverse in from the right, then follow three bolts up the arete on the left.

There’s a direct start up a lichen-filled seam in crumbly rock that can be done at around 5.9, but it’d need cleaning and requires a couple tiny nuts/RPs to lead.

To get off, rap south or walk off north.
content.protection: Three bolts plus an anchor.
content.location: See the “Area D overview” drawing in the photos. Approach by walking around the west side of the formation to the lower south side. Begin right, and ascend the left side of a dish-shaped face.

content.description:
This is a right-facing, overhanging corner. It is mostly fists but has 1 or 2 slightly wider spots to negotiate.

Ground rules: none.

The standing start is 10b. The sit start has a 10b section low plus the one up higher - double credit.
content.protection: Your choice: boulder/solo, crash pad, spotter, tether with large cam(s), or TR.
content.location: See the Area D map. It is on a ramp around the back side facing southwest.

content.description:
Follow three bolts up the center-right side of the face.

To get off, rap south or walk off north.
content.protection: Three bolts plus an anchor.
content.location: See the “Area D Overview” drawing in the photos. Ascend the center-right of a dish-shaped face starting low on the south side of the formation.

climbs.name: C6 - Chimney to Right in Hole

content.description:
This is a short, easy chimney. Choose your width. It's there, so why not? Two stars is generous.

Ground rules: none. Can you sit start a chimney?
content.protection: None and none is needed.
content.location: Enter the hole form the east. This is the chimney to the north.

climbs.name: C5 - Wide OW Straight-On in Hole

content.description:
This is wide to begin then narrows higher up. It is physical and burly.

Ground rules: sit start. Anything goes for holds.
content.protection: None. You can step across the chimney to exit if not comfortable.
content.location: Enter hole from the east. This is the crack/slot to the west which is a continuation of the entrance slot.

climbs.name: C4 - OW to Left in Hole

content.description:
This is a moderately long OW with tighter-than-knee crux up a bit.

Ground rules for 10a: sit start. Use ledge on the left for your feet but no hands out of the crack.

Ground rules for 10c/d: sit start. Use your feet and hands only in the crack.
content.protection: None. You can bridge across to the opposite side of slot/chimney if not comfortable.
content.location: Walk/squeeze into the hole from the east. This is the southern crack.

content.description:
This is a nice chimney that almost feels like a real climb. Don't fall. Downclimb by scrambling to the east.

Ground rules: none - use what you can find.
content.protection: A cool head.
content.location: Walk through a pinch between two boulders, and work back around some blocks to the right.

content.description:
Climb the flake/ramp to the log, then scramble to the top. Downclimb to the east.

Ground rules: none - anything goes.
content.protection: None - although you may be able to lead it on real big gear or TR it if you want.
content.location: Walk between a pinch between two boulders and then into the cave.

content.description: Birdshot is a beautiful line that is complete choss. Hold on for dear life, because the mantel to start is the easy part if your head game isn't strong. Mantel up onto the spine, and then climb the spine all the way to the top.

This is a right-facing, overhanging, OW corner. The cruxes are tighter-than-knee.

Ground rules for .10c: standing start, anything goes.

Ground rules for .10d/11a: sit start, anything goes.
content.protection: None or a spotter. Alternatively use a large cam on a tether. Note that a crash pad won't help much, since the concern is falling out with your leg caught in the crack.
content.location: Wind your way through small boulders, squeeze through a passage, then look right.

content.description:
Climb flaring, tight hands around the block. This is a bit contrived.

Ground rules: sit start with both feet to the right and at least one jammed in the crack. All face holds are on for the feet, no face holds are on for the hands.
content.protection: None needed - it's a butt dragger.
content.location: Walk into the alcove just past the campfire remnants, and look down to the right.

content.description:
This is a nice, vertical splitter that is mostly hands and smaller.

Ground rules: sit start. You get extra credit for doing the final moves to ledge by jamming the crack while avoiding face holds.
content.protection: A spotter. You could set up a TR if desired.
content.location: See the overview drawing.

content.description:
This is short and stout but succumbs to good technique.

Ground rules: start with both feet on low rock to the right. The range in ratings is based on whether you use face holds with your right hand or not.
content.protection: None.
content.location: See the overview drawing. It is in a bit of a hole to the left.

content.description: Muscle up the A-frame roof with a short move/sequence.
content.protection: A spotter.
content.location: See the “Area B overview” drawing in the photos. Ascend the north side of a pinch point roof you can sneak under.

content.description:
This is the tall chimney that is climbed on the NE side of the pinch.

Ground rules: tight or wide - it's your choice. Don't fall.
content.protection: Your confidence.
content.location:
Walk (squeeze) into the base from A5 and

A7

.

content.description:
This is long with mostly hands with some fists in questionable rock. If not comfortable, you can bridge to the opposite wall. At the top, step forward and stem across to get off.

Ground rules: climb only the crack, and don't bridge to the opposite wall.
content.protection: You may be able to TR it, but the crack is flaring and the rock is poor. Stem across chimney if you're not comfortable.
content.location: See the area A map. Scramble up to top from the east, then chimney down to the start.

content.description: This climbs a hand crack pinching to fingers in poor rock.
content.protection: A couple cams.
content.location: See the “Area A overview” drawing in the main area photos and “A11 location” below. This is 135’ SE of main “A” rocks on small boulder pile.

content.description: Face climb up, traverse right, and mantel onto top. A direct/left variation is likely possible but has not been done. See the “A10 detail” drawing below in the photos.
content.protection: Spotter and/or pads.
content.location: See the “Area A overview” drawing in the area photos and the “A10 location” below. This is on a short face low on the ESE corner of the formation.
